page.title: 15GLEASTON CASTLE.
page.content: MR.William Webster is the farmer at Gleaston Castle. His wife said it was built in the 13th.-14th.century from stone quarried across the road. It was poorly constructed with only rubble between the stones instead of mortar and so fell into ruins long before Elizabeth 1 came to the throne. It was never fully completed, because the Scotish raids against which it had been built had ceased and there was no longer the need for such a stronghold. The ruins of the two completed towers are still there today.It is said that the Harrington family had it built but lived in it for only about 50 years. Nothing has been done to restore the castle but there is a preservation order on it. The farmer's cows and sheep roam in and out of the remains and there is nearly always a bull around. Perhaps he is on guard!
